column9: was diagnosed with severe dyshydrotic eczema. i had both extremely dry/cracked skin and wet blisters on both hands. really painful and unsightly. was prescribed medrol. day 1: 10 minutes after i took the first dose, i felt as if every blister on my hand had a heartbeat! it hurt like mad, but thinking in retrospect, i think the meds were making their way thru my body (yes, that quick!). couldn't sleep much that night. woke up every hour. day 2: woke up with absolutely no pain whatsoever! hands were still an eyesore, but they didn't hurt anymore! day 3: hands start looking like they're healing! day 4: hands are about 50% healed. blisters dried out, no new ones. day 4: hands 75% healed and i can make a fist for the first time in 2 weeks! day 5: hands 90% healed. feel great. -- DEFINITELY SATISFIED WITH THIS MEDICATION!

This was at 02:30hrs!! My wife, (thank you again God) found me and called Paramedic's. I'll NEVER take Medrol again,PLEASE be careful if your MD RX"s it to you. God Bless and best of health.

column9: The pain in my shoulder, hip, and spine completely disappeared by the third day on the  Medrol Pak. I only wish I could use it more often, because the symptoms reappear in a few weeks

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine worked great. I couldn't use it for long though, because I'm only 16 and it is a steriod. But overall, I felt little or no pain in my shoulders.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had sever swelling of feet and legs, back leg and feet pain, cough, very little sleep the benifits of this drug do not out way the side affects, i hurt worse than i did before i took this med

column2: rired86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed a Medrol pack (oral) to take over the course of six days, to prevent inflammation following oral surgery (specifically, a tooth extraction).  It proved to be a complete nightmare. Not only did my entire face swell up like a grotesque balloon (both the side where the tooth was extracted and the opposite side), but I quite literally gained 9 (nine) pounds in three days.  Believe me, I know; I weigh myself at least a dozen times a day, and watched in horror as my weight climbed rapidly.  I also experienced extreme fatigue and bruising (on both my shins) with little, perhaps no, provocation.  Apparently, these symptoms are part of a reaction to Medrol that some people have.  If my oral surgeon had told me that this was a possibility beforehand, I would never have taken this medication.
